poem:
"Resilience in Recession"

Steel spins in finance halls boundless,
Hope's penny in the hands of uncrowned Sunak.
Grows though dark the economy's robe,
A troubled child's vessel tipped, then righted.
Prophet voices cry 'Rise, rise from ruin!'
Yet, in numbers nested lies not the land's pulse.
Look there, look where stones hush for Spring's verse
And growth reveals in whispered greens, not gilded percentages.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
